oai_dc:dc.dc:title: GROWTH-RATE DISPERSION IN MSMPR CRYSTALLIZERS - SOLUTION BY REGULARIZATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GUPTA, V
BHATIA, SK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: contact nucleation
sucrose crystallization
agglomeration kinetics
size distribution
equations
sulfate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An inverse problem approach is formulated for the determination of growth rate dispersion from measurement of size distribution of crystals in mixed-suspension mixed-product removal crystallizers. The resulting Fredholm integral equation of the first kind, which is ill-posed, is solved by combining regularization with three different methods of representation of the unknown distribution. The methods are shown to be relatively insensitive to experimental error. Application to the analysis of published data on the sucrose-water system is also demonstrated, and it is seen that the different methods yield similar solutions.
